This makes us a powerful development partner for industry and a top employer in the scientific community. Our Center Health & Bioresources is seeking to hire new Ingenious Partners for our location in Vienna:

Junior Scientist (m/f/d) for Molecular Diagnostics (Limited until: 31.12.2024)

- Center for Health & Bioresources

Imagine

  • As part of our team, you will support the molecular biology laboratory in the area of DNA and protein chip technology as well as Next Generation Sequencing applications.
  • Together with your colleagues, you will work on projects for the identification and validation of new biomarkers.

Engage

  • Your expertise in microarray, Next Generation Sequencing, qPCR and ELISA analyses enables you to apply them for biomarker discovery and verification in tissues and body fluids.
  • You plan and conduct experiments, prepare analytical data and write scientific publications largely independently.
  • You play an active role in contributing to our portfolio of our minimally-invasive biomarker technologies.

Achieve

  • Based on your research, you will prepare reports underlying your results and outcomes and will be in close contact to our research project partners.
  • You enjoy working in an interdisciplinary research team.

Your qualifications as an Ingenious Partner:

  • Completed studies (MSc) in the field of biotechnology, molecular biology
  • Vast and diverse laboratory experience in the field of molecular biology, biotechnology
  • Interest in handling projects, data preparation and preparing reports
  • Accuracy, reliability, and analytical thinking
  • Communication skills, sense of responsibility and commitment, ability to work in a team

What to expect:
The minimum gross annual salary according to the collective agreement is EUR 45.836,--. The actual salary will be determined individually, based on your qualifications and experience. In addition, we offer company benefits, flexible working conditions, individual training and career opportunities.

At AIT, the promotion of women is important to us - that's why we are especially looking forward to hearing from female applicants!

Please submit your application documents including CV, motivation letter and certificates online.
